review: As a confirmed Roku fan, I was a little reluctant to give a different streaming device a try. But the Fire TV Stick has more power and memory than the old streamer in my bedroom, and the price (and the fact that we already have a Prime account) made it an affordable gamble. The UI took a little getting used to (it definitely puts your Amazon Prime options front and center, and sort of relegates apps like Netflix and Hulu Plus to secondary options), but by the end of the first evening I found it very user-friendly and navigable. It creates a much more stable connection to our wireless network than our old Roku XD, loads faster, and generally does everything we need it to. The Roku 3 is still my 5 star main streaming device (it's in the living room - the Fire Stick is in the bedroom), but the Fire TV Stick is a great option, and well worth the money, particularly if you're a Prime customer. PLEASE NOTE: While not pictured, the device does need to be plugged in via a power cable to work.
